name: ListNotifications
description:
Retrieve notifications within a specified time range.

This tool retrieves notifications for a given time range, which can be filtered by type such as SMS, email, phone, or push notifications. Notifications are created when an incident is triggered or escalated.

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: The start date for the search range. Time is optional and must match format of 'until'.

value_schema.description: The start of the date range over which you want to search. The time element is optional.

parameters.name: end_date_for_search
parameters.description: The end of the date range for the search. Must be in the same format as the 'since' date and within 3 months of it.

value_schema.description: The end of the date range over which you want to search. This should be in the same format as since. The size of the date range must be less than 3 months.

parameters.name: accept_version_header
parameters.description: Specify the API version to use for the request, using the 'Accept' header.

value_schema.description: The `Accept` header is used as a versioning header.

parameters.name: content_type_header
parameters.description: Specifies the format of the request, must be 'application/json'.

parameters.description: The number of results to display per page.

value_schema.description: The number of results per page.

parameters.name: pagination_offset
parameters.description: Offset number to begin the pagination of search results.

value_schema.description: Offset to start pagination search results.

parameters.name: output_time_zone
parameters.description: Time zone for rendering results. Defaults to the account's time zone if not specified.

value_schema.description: Time zone in which results will be rendered. This will default to the account time zone.

parameters.name: notification_type_filter
parameters.description: Return notifications of a specific type such as SMS, email, phone, or push.

parameters.description: Set to true to populate the total field in pagination responses, otherwise it will be null.
